title: Immoral Tales 1974 Original Version 720P
description:
TITLE: Contes Immoraux 
YEAR: 1974
AKA: Immoral Tales - I Racconti Immorali di Borowczyk
DIRECTOR: Walerian Borowczyk 
AUDIO: Italian - French 
SUBTITLES: English

Erotic tales from in various historical eras. This original version features a fifth tale, La Bete a.k.a. The Beast, which the Polish director later on developed into a feature film which was completed in 1975, a year after Immoral Tales.

The Tide: set in present days (sometime during the early 70s), a handsome boy (Fabrice Luchini) and his cousin (Lise Danvers) visit a secluded beach. There they play a game and the boy seduces the girl.

TherÃ¨se Philosophe: about a pious young girl (Charlotte Alexandra) who angers her mother and gets locked up in a room for three days and three nights. There the girl begins experimenting with her body and discovers sexual bliss. 

Erzebet Bathory: the notorious countess (Paloma Picasso) and a group of soldiers visit Nyitra County in Hungary. They seize young virgins and then promptly return to Bathory's castle. The bloody finale of this short has to be seen to be believed. 

The Beast: offers a fascinating interpretation of the popular story about the legendary beast of Gevaudan. The beast appears somewhere in the Massif Central region and attacks a young and beautiful woman (Sirpa Lane). But instead of killing her, the horny beast rapes her.

Lucrezia Borgia: in 1498 Lucrezia Borgia and her husband, Giovanni Sforza, Count of Pesaro, visit her father, Pope Alexander VI and brother, Cardinal Cesare Borgia. During a ceremony, the Pope reveals the impotence of his son-in-law and humiliates him.
